Two-Handed Stance

Requirement: A melee weapon with the Two-Handed trait, or a Versatile weapon held in two hands.

Both hands on your weapon, you rest it on your shoulder. You widen your stance to support full-body swings, tightening your grip in anticipation.

Pros

Cleave

  • Once per turn, during your attack action, you can attack two creatures so long as they are both:
    • Within reach of you.
    • Within 10ft of each other.

Called Shot

  • In place of an attack, you prepare a strike, immediately ending your turn.
  • At the beginning of your next turn, you use the attack action against a target within range, or else cancel the Called Shot. The first attack in this attack action automatically hits and is a critical hit.
  • You can take a desperate action to trigger the called shot critical hit early, but you gain a level of @Compendium[undertaking.conditions.ERBR3AG01H4N1L91]{Exhaustion} and cannot take a desperate action until the end of your next full turn. If you otherwise take an action or attack before you trigger your called shot, your strike is no longer prepared.

Fulcrum-Free

  • You can wield two-handed weapons using one hand, but one-handed attacks are made at disadvantage.

Cons

Full Swing

  • Attack actions take up both your action and minor action.
